page.title: 17Principal Features LISVANE
page.content: Much of the landscape is forestry commission woodland and,forest and bushes and enclosed fields used for grazing.The dormitory village of Lisvane and the expanding housing estate of Thornhill lie in the south of the block.High ground splits the block in two reaching a height of 270m and in part carries the county boundary between Mid and South Glamorgan.Other features:M4 motorway,Cardiff to Rhymney railway,1\ km.long railway tunnel,13th.century church of St.Denys,Cefn Onn Park,Llanishen Golf Club,a Welsh long barn(1760)a Wales Gas storage depot,small farms and disused:-reservoir,mining pits and tips,quarries and kilns.
